author: Special Correspondent
text:
Student stabbed

to death

A 19-year-old college student was killed in a road rage incident in Ramaswamy Palya on Friday evening. The victim, second-year PUC student Samson Bharat, was returning from tuition with his classmate Sunil on their bicycles when they collided with Prakash, who was riding his bicycle in the opposite direction.

The incident occurred around 9 p.m. It led to an argument during which Prakash allegedly slapped Sunil, stabbed Bharat and escaped. Sunil and passersby took Bharat to a hospital where he was declared dead on arrival.

The police have arrested Prakash (20), a painter and resident of Ramaswamy Palya, for murder based on a complaint by Bharat’s father Balakrishna, a cab driver.
title: PU student stabbed to death
